review: Watch_Dogs is a highly addicting, but sometimes stressful game. The protagonist Aiden Pearce isn't a very fleshed out character, but the other characters make up for that ten fold. The hacking mechanic in this game is ridiculously fun, especailly hacking people's phones to listen in on their conversations and to blow up a transformer on the ground. My biggest gripe with this game is the difficulty. The gang hideouts, and missions with similar structure(hiding behind stuff, shooting, using cameras), are relatively easy. On the other hand, the driving missions are the most infuriating in any open world game I have ever played. The police are a lot like the police everyone knows and hates from Grand Theft Auto, where they try to run you off the road. On top of that the fixers will do the exact same thing. Often times I found myself throwing my headphones off in frusteration over these missions, but the majority of the game and the nail biting story kept me coming back for more. I would definitely highly reccomend this game, just be careful with the driving missions.

review:
No just not !!! i pre order this game and was really looking forward, i saw is some game that will beat GTAV or PC version of GTA but you can hack everthing, unfortunately i was wrong.

OK so, lets first start talk about the graphcis is poor really SH!T almost like Saint Row 3 i mean come on even GTA IV can beat Watch_Dogs graphics in 2014 ! a game that come out in 2008 can beat a game come out in 2014 SERIOUSLY ??? (i did heard that the console version of Watch_Dogs are way better than PC,maybe this is just not a PC game ?)what is wrong with Ubisoft OMG...... just forget i also spend 40 bloody british pound for this game, i really dont mind about spend money on the game i love but sometime when is come to the game you will not get a goddamn penny from my pocket !

Is the game a open world ? yep pretty much you can drive around city, run over people, rob shop, theres only 2 type of shop availble for you to actually SHOPPING Clothes shop and gun store.i feel like the Ubisoft actually stole those thing from rockstar...... but with some really rubbish graphics and added hack.

Everyone Watch_Dogs this whole game is focus on one thing adn that is hacking so, whats you can actually hack ? like other game you get skill point after complete each different mission and you can spend on skill tree like control bridage and road block those really simple thing.

I don't normally post bad review,but i just want speak thing of true.

review:
So after finishing the whole game and playing a good bit of online, I can can honestly say this.

1. Story is very damn bland, feels like a Batman story line that all told to the devs though a can with a string.

2.  Proformance issues is a big problem, there is a mod that lessens studders and crashes along with making the game look like the E3 2012 "Gameplay" if you want to call it that.

3. uPlay is needed to play, enough said.

4. Driving, physics, and shooting mechanics seem to have been their second to last priority.

5. There is no getting your money back if you pay for it and say "I cannot play your game without destroying my harddrive graphics card from all these crashes and game saves croupting." to ubisoft support. Mind you I sent that request to support a week into the release.

6. All DLC/Pre-order outfits/guns are either given or out matched by other items in game.

7. DLC seems like the other quarter of this half assed game.

8. In multiplayer you have an option between a select few AI's and not wanna be Batman.

9. Multiplayer has no offical servers, matches are hosted by players with the worst ping.

10. The coolest thing in watch dogs was right before the end when you get the chance to use and app on your phone to stop a peace maker like in this video (http://youtu.be/cI8IJeuyeZw?t=7m2s) and thats about it.

Oh and fare warning to those who get this unfinished half @5$3|) game, you will probably crash a lot more than usual when you hear of Default and get done with the peace maker part, thats where I seemed to crash the most.

review:
มาถึงเกมที่หลายคนตั้งตารอ ซึ่งผมก็เป็นหนึ่งในนั้นที่คาดหวังกับเกมโอเพ่นเวิร์ดที่มีความแปลก แหวก และน่าลิ้มลองเป็นอย่างมาก กับฟอร์มเกมที่เทียบกับหนังฟอร์มใหญ่ก็ไม่ปาน แต่ก็ตัดสินใจอยู่นานกว่าจะกดซื้อเมื่อเกมออกจริงๆ เพราะเมื่อดูจากวิจารณ์จากหลายสื่อแล้วนั้นเกมนี้อาจไม่ได้ตอบโจทย์หรือตอบสนองความคาดหวังเหล่าเกมเมอร์ชั้นเซียนที่วาดฝันกับเกมนี้ไว้เยอะ แต่ก็ยังเป็นเกมที่เล่นสนุกสำหรับเกมเมอร์มีใจรักในเกมแนวโลกเปิดเป็นทุนเดิม (อย่างผม) อย่างแน่นอนครับ

เริ่มจากส่วนที่ทุกคนคงประเมินจากการปล่อยตัวอย่างเกมมาให้เห็นกันก่อน คือกราฟิกระดับเกมยุคหน้า (Next gen) ที่ดูสมจริง สวยงาม และน่าเที่ยวเล่นอย่างมาก แต่เมื่อเกมถูกปรับแต่ง (Optimized) เพื่อให้เล่นได้ในทุกแพลตฟอร์มก็ต้องปรับให้มีความลื่นไหลและทำงานได้ดีที่สุด จึงส่งผลให้ระดับกราฟิกลดลง แต่ก็มี Mod หรือชุดคำสั่งที่ออกมาปรับแต่งให้การแสดงผลดูดีขึ้น แต่ก็ต้องแลกมากับสเป็กที่สูงขึ้น ส่วนตัวก็พอใจอยู่ที่เกมเล่นได้ดีโดยให้ภาพที่ถือว่าไม่ขี้เหร่นัก แต่หวังว่าจะมีแพทช์มาให้ผู้เล่นได้ปรับแต่งได้อย่างอิสระมากขึ้นกว่านี้ และโชว์กราฟิกระดับเทพที่ทางผู้พัฒนาเตรียมไว้ให้เห็นเป็นประจักษ์ในเร็ววัน (ผมยังนึกเปรียบเทียบกับ Sleeping dog ว่าอยากได้บรรยากาศประมาณนั้นนะ แต่ตอนนี้ยังไม่ใช่อะ)

ส่วนของเกมเพลย์หรือรูปแบบการเล่นนอกจากการเล่นแบบโลกเปิดที่ทุกคนคุ้นเคยแล้ว ระบบที่เป็นจุดขายของเกมนี้คือระบบเครือข่ายผ่าน ctOS  ที่ทำให้คนธรรมดาเป็นยอดมนุษย์ได้ สามารถ เข้าถึง เปิด ปิด สั่งงาน ควบคุม ตรวจสอบ แก้ไข ปรับแต่ง อุปกรณ์อิเล็กทรอนิกส์ได้เกือบจะทุกอย่างในเกม จนเหมือนว่าจะติดนิสัยความสะดวก และลืมระบบการสั่งงานแบบเก่ากันเลย ทำให้ความสามารถนี้กลายเป็นเรื่องปกติ ใช้จนเบื่อและเป็นเทคนิคเดิมๆ ทั้งการระบุตัวตนด้วยมือถือ การแฮคระบบ ผมว่ามันซ้ำซากอยู่บ้าง คือแต่ละภาระกิจจะมีรูปแบบเดิมๆ แค่เปลี่ยนแผนที่และความยากนิดหน่อย แต่วิธีการมันเหมือนๆ กันหมดอะ ความสมจริงก็มีบ้างไม่มีบ้าง เช่น การขับรถผมว่ายังสู้ GTA ไม่ค่อยได้ ระบบขับขี่ง่าย และไม่สมจริงนัก แต่ก็ช่วยให้เล่นเกมที่ต้องหนีตำรวจบ่อยๆ แบบนี้ได้ง่ายขึ้นนะครับ และส่วนการเล่นอื่นๆ ยังคลายหรือเหมือนๆ เกมอื่นของ Ubisoft อย่าง AC หรือ Farcry3 เข้าไปอีกทั้งการเปิดแผนที่ การสำรวจจุดสำคัญเพื่อสร้างความได้เปรียบ การส่องระบุตำแหน่งศัตรู เป็นต้น

สรุปท้ายแล้วเกมนี้เล่นจบเนื้อเรื่องหลักและเก็บเควสย่อยส่วนใหญ่ได้ภายใน 15-20 ชม. นอกนั้นอาจจะเป็นภาระกิจที่เกิดแบบสุ่มๆ นั่นก็ขี้เกียจเล่นอีกเพราะมันเหมือนๆ เดิม (จริงๆนะ) ความสนุกที่ผมชอบคือการใช้มือถือทำงานในระยะไกล เพราะมันทำได้หลายสิ่งจริงๆ และเควสต่างๆ ที่เล่นผ่านระบบมือถือในเกมก็มีหลายโหมด และระบบเล่นออนไลน์ที่สนุก โดยรวมถือว่าเล่นได้สนุกแต่ไม่สุด หลายๆ จุดน่าจะมีทางเลือก หรือแนวทางการเล่นที่หลากหลายได้โดยเฉพาะเควสย่อยที่ซ้ำซากทีเดียว และด้วยเกมกลัวคนเล่นจะสร้างสรรค์มากเกินไปเลยตีกรอบ กำหนดวิธีการเล่นมากไปหน่อย ยิ่งด่านหลังๆ แล้วแทบทำอะไรไม่ค่อยได้ศัตรูรู้ทันไปหมด จริงๆ เนื้อเรื่องอยากให้มีทีมแฮ็คแข่งกัน ยึดเมืองเป็นโซนๆ ถ้าข้ามโซนก็น่าจะมีเควสหรือการแข่งกันแก้ระบบหรืออื่นๆ ไปน่าจะสนุกและมีอะไรให้เล่นมากกว่านี้นะครับ เอาไป 7/10
raw_json:
{"recommendationid": "11101734", "author": {"steamid": "76561197971311234", "num_games_owned": 0, "num_reviews": 61, "playtime_forever": 1257, "playtime_last_two_weeks": 0, "playtime_at_review": 1257, "last_played": 1404831400}, "language": "thai", "review": "มาถึงเกมที่หลายคนตั้งตารอ ซึ่งผมก็เป็นหนึ่งในนั้นที่คาดหวังกับเกมโอเพ่นเวิร์ดที่มีความแปลก แหวก และน่าลิ้มลองเป็นอย่างมาก กับฟอร์มเกมที่เทียบกับหนังฟอร์มใหญ่ก็ไม่ปาน แต่ก็ตัดสินใจอยู่นานกว่าจะกดซื้อเมื่อเกมออกจริงๆ เพราะเมื่อดูจากวิจารณ์จากหลายสื่อแล้วนั้นเกมนี้อาจไม่ได้ตอบโจทย์หรือตอบสนองความคาดหวังเหล่าเกมเมอร์ชั้นเซียนที่วาดฝันกับเกมนี้ไว้เยอะ แต่ก็ยังเป็นเกมที่เล่นสนุกสำหรับเกมเมอร์มีใจรักในเกมแนวโลกเปิดเป็นทุนเดิม (อย่างผม) อย่างแน่นอนครับ

เริ่มจากส่วนที่ทุกคนคงประเมินจากการปล่อยตัวอย่างเกมมาให้เห็นกันก่อน คือกราฟิกระดับเกมยุคหน้า (Next gen) ที่ดูสมจริง สวยงาม และน่าเที่ยวเล่นอย่างมาก แต่เมื่อเกมถูกปรับแต่ง (Optimized) เพื่อให้เล่นได้ในทุกแพลตฟอร์มก็ต้องปรับให้มีความลื่นไหลและทำงานได้ดีที่สุด จึงส่งผลให้ระดับกราฟิกลดลง แต่ก็มี Mod หรือชุดคำสั่งที่ออกมาปรับแต่งให้การแสดงผลดูดีขึ้น แต่ก็ต้องแลกมากับสเป็กที่สูงขึ้น ส่วนตัวก็พอใจอยู่ที่เกมเล่นได้ดีโดยให้ภาพที่ถือว่าไม่ขี้เหร่นัก แต่หวังว่าจะมีแพทช์มาให้ผู้เล่นได้ปรับแต่งได้อย่างอิสระมากขึ้นกว่านี้ และโชว์กราฟิกระดับเทพที่ทางผู้พัฒนาเตรียมไว้ให้เห็นเป็นประจักษ์ในเร็ววัน (ผมยังนึกเปรียบเทียบกับ Sleeping dog ว่าอยากได้บรรยากาศประมาณนั้นนะ แต่ตอนนี้ยังไม่ใช่อะ)

ส่วนของเกมเพลย์หรือรูปแบบการเล่นนอกจากการเล่นแบบโลกเปิดที่ทุกคนคุ้นเคยแล้ว ระบบที่เป็นจุดขายของเกมนี้คือระบบเครือข่ายผ่าน ctOS  ที่ทำให้คนธรรมดาเป็นยอดมนุษย์ได้ สามารถ เข้าถึง เปิด ปิด สั่งงาน ควบคุม ตรวจสอบ แก้ไข ปรับแต่ง อุปกรณ์อิเล็กทรอนิกส์ได้เกือบจะทุกอย่างในเกม จนเหมือนว่าจะติดนิสัยความสะดวก และลืมระบบการสั่งงานแบบเก่ากันเลย ทำให้ความสามารถนี้กลายเป็นเรื่องปกติ ใช้จนเบื่อและเป็นเทคนิคเดิมๆ ทั้งการระบุตัวตนด้วยมือถือ การแฮคระบบ ผมว่ามันซ้ำซากอยู่บ้าง คือแต่ละภาระกิจจะมีรูปแบบเดิมๆ แค่เปลี่ยนแผนที่และความยากนิดหน่อย แต่วิธีการมันเหมือนๆ กันหมดอะ ความสมจริงก็มีบ้างไม่มีบ้าง เช่น การขับรถผมว่ายังสู้ GTA ไม่ค่อยได้ ระบบขับขี่ง่าย และไม่สมจริงนัก แต่ก็ช่วยให้เล่นเกมที่ต้องหนีตำรวจบ่อยๆ แบบนี้ได้ง่ายขึ้นนะครับ และส่วนการเล่นอื่นๆ ยังคลายหรือเหมือนๆ เกมอื่นของ Ubisoft อย่าง AC หรือ Farcry3 เข้าไปอีกทั้งการเปิดแผนที่ การสำรวจจุดสำคัญเพื่อสร้างความได้เปรียบ การส่องระบุตำแหน่งศัตรู เป็นต้น

สรุปท้ายแล้วเกมนี้เล่นจบเนื้อเรื่องหลักและเก็บเควสย่อยส่วนใหญ่ได้ภายใน 15-20 ชม. นอกนั้นอาจจะเป็นภาระกิจที่เกิดแบบสุ่มๆ นั่นก็ขี้เกียจเล่นอีกเพราะมันเหมือนๆ เดิม (จริงๆนะ) ความสนุกที่ผมชอบคือการใช้มือถือทำงานในระยะไกล เพราะมันทำได้หลายสิ่งจริงๆ และเควสต่างๆ ที่เล่นผ่านระบบมือถือในเกมก็มีหลายโหมด และระบบเล่นออนไลน์ที่สนุก โดยรวมถือว่าเล่นได้สนุกแต่ไม่สุด หลายๆ จุดน่าจะมีทางเลือก หรือแนวทางการเล่นที่หลากหลายได้โดยเฉพาะเควสย่อยที่ซ้ำซากทีเดียว และด้วยเกมกลัวคนเล่นจะสร้างสรรค์มากเกินไปเลยตีกรอบ กำหนดวิธีการเล่นมากไปหน่อย ยิ่งด่านหลังๆ แล้วแทบทำอะไรไม่ค่อยได้ศัตรูรู้ทันไปหมด จริงๆ เนื้อเรื่องอยากให้มีทีมแฮ็คแข่งกัน ยึดเมืองเป็นโซนๆ ถ้าข้ามโซนก็น่าจะมีเควสหรือการแข่งกันแก้ระบบหรืออื่นๆ ไปน่าจะสนุกและมีอะไรให้เล่นมากกว่านี้นะครับ เอาไป 7/10", "timestamp_created": 1404656255, "timestamp_updated": 1404656255, "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 13, "votes_funny": 1, "weighted_vote_score": "0.677111029624938965", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
Все кто говорит что игра говно, идите в жопу. Мне игра очень понравилась. Да не графон как в крайзисе но картинка весьма приятная. Гемлей очень разнообразный. Помимо основной сюжетной линии можно заняться и второстепенными зданиями. Мини игры весьма интересные. Случайные задания и события в городе делают его более живым. Ты как будто сам живешь в Чикаго, ты управляешь этим городом. Насчет сюжета скажу что он своеобразный, да не супер но весьма и весьма интересный. 

РЕКОМЕНДУЮ!!!!!!!!!

review: Decent gameplay barely redeems the terrible dialogue and story in Watchdogs.  It would not have been so bad had the character you play not been so utterly unlikeable as Aiden Pearce is.  And then there is uplay, which you are forced to click through in order to start and exit the game.  Uplay is what pushes my review into "Do not recommend" territory.  In the future I will be paying attention to which games require Uplay and not purchasing them.

review:
Достоинства: Сюжет, графика, открытый мир. Полностью русская озвучка.
Недостатки: Физика.
Купил я сегодня данную игру. Для PS4 - В "М. ВИДЕО" Она стоила - 3000 рублей. Не плохо, так как пора бы уже привыкать платить за интелектульную собственность ровно столько же как и за материальную. 
Через неделю игры. Графика: Я не видел рекламы с "Е3". Да для мощностей PS4 - она выглядит ну уж не очень. Но так как она создавалось для PS3 и XBOX 360 то для них графика определённо отличная. Физика: Это смешно :) Машины в игре просто потрясающие, есть режим "вид водителя из машины". Но физика машин убивает. Машины практически не убиваемые. Максимум дымок. За всю игру так и не смог уничтожить не одну машину. При прыжке с трамплином машина не крениться передом вниз. Она как в GTA SA. Разрушение: Всё как в GTA SA. Столбы ломается, ломается всё кроме деревьев "внимание!!" в железной оградке. А обычные в пух и прах. Сюжет: Да первое время скучноват. Но в финале всё расскрываеться. И после прохождения он искажаться просто божественным.

review:
Игра восхитительна по своему жанру. Советую всем. (Это в общем) 
А теперь поконкретней:
Хейтеры! Они говорят, что игра не удалась. Согласен только с тем, что графон сделали хуже, чем было на Е3. Но подумаем со стороны разработчиков - менее требовательная игра = больше покупок. 
Все, кто говорит, что игра "one click to WIN". Даже скажем, что это так. НО, представте, что вы уезжаете от полиции, вам нужно поднять пост, и там же вам требуют провести определенную махинацию (Допустим нажать определенную комбинацию - всегда разную). Глупо тратить на это время. Так что думаю, что нажатие клавиши "Q" хоть и нестоль увлекательное занятие, но и ненадоедат, согласитесь, ведь каждый раз отвлекатся на дополнителые махинации вскоре достанет.
Теперь об автомобилях:
1) Управление - редкосное дерьмо. Привыкнуть можно, но после того, как я зашел снова в GTA V - ощущения дороги, идеально управление :). Конечно управление не супер, но разве игра о гонках? О машинах? Я думаю нет.
2) Машины не гнутся... Думаю ответ выше. (разве игра о гонках? О машинах? Я думаю нет)
Всем, кто сомневается о покупке  - рекомендую. Игра удалась. Есть сюжет, интересный концепт. Если же вам этого недостаточно, то в добавок вы получаете весьма не плохой мультиплеер.

review: I'm  really disapointed, another person who wanted watchdogs to test thier rig, and to enjoy at the same time. Benchmark this against even GTA IV the graphics are about the same, it just feels like a GTA with less freedom. The missions are insanely hard sometimes as well, take on 10 guys who all have machine guns, and you have to knock 2 out before you can kill any of them, and a specific 2! The graphics are poor, the driving is terrible, the gun aiming is slow, the "hacking" is unimaginative, and the NPC AI sucks. All of the above are below par from other games, I wasted £40 on this, and I can't even get a refund.

review:
A very interesting take on modern applications of technology such as the internet, security, and city-wide control systems, Watch_Dogs is definitely an enjoyable experience. The campaign plays out the tragic story of Aiden Pearce, a vigilante grey hat hacker who searches for the cause of the death of his niece. 

While the campaign is definitely a decently written part of the game, the primary, and most boasted feature of the game is what is referred to as 'online hacking'. This segment features the player entering the world of another player and attempting to install a 'backdoor' into their phone to steal information. Though the premise is original, and the gameplay was enjoyable there for a while, the online play is plagued with fatal mistakes in design that allow players to exploit the system in order to avoid losing points for losing at any given mission. 

Most of the time, players simply leave the game mid-session in order to avoid their punishment. Sadly, this exploit works both ways, so even if I find myself being hacked, and I discover the hacker, they are easily able to quick the mission and avoid losing points. 

Really, most of the game's hype relied on this online aspect, and the fact that it is ruined by young kids with a poor sense of sportsmanship detracts from the overall appeal. In my opinion, the campaign alone is not enough to make up for the massive holes in the online feature. Until this is updated to prevent such slimy cheats, I say you save your money on this one.

review:
The concept for this game was amazing. Open world... you can control everything... at least that's what i was hoping for. But the execution of this game however was not the best. It had all the features they promised, and yet it lacked something.

The CONS:
The driving mechanics were horrible. Very delayed, I guess with Ubisoft dealing with Warthog like driving for many years they fail to realise how responsive we want it to be. Not only that, you wield guns and dispose of people in various fashions. Yet there is no shooting out of the vehicle function/mechanic. This frustrated me very hard as the only way to rid of the people chasing you were the traffic lights and blockers you encounter. Granted they are a great way to display the powers of hacking. It does get annoying when you are followed by a helicopter and it does not ever leave you. 

There have been many other things pointed out by the community, such as going out to the sea and police not being able to follow you. Another is that all the vehicles only have 1 person, the driver, never any passengers. These are just small things. Granted its the first of its 'franchise' titles. 

Another thing that is frustrating is the  obvious hacking of the online multi-player games, and by this I do not mean the use of the mechanics in the game, but actual hacking such as aim bots. It does not help that the aiming mechanics are so slow and sluggish (this is coming from a regular first person shooter player, may vary from person to person). Not to mention you CANNOT JUMP... the amount of times I have to run around a small object instead of jumping it, I'm not talking about a fence, i'm talking about a rock on the road.

The story-line is kind of stale, there is no twist... no edge, it is very predictable.

The Pros:
Like I said, the concept of it was fantastic, the camera to camera controlling to scout the environment, executing people without being in the same room shows the futuristic theme where we depend on technology. And the stealth functions coupled with instant peek over head shots makes this a breeze for stealth players like me. It was a good attempt to make a foundation for a new franchise, but it needs tremendous amounts of refinement to be anywhere near that. The bar for what is good in a AAA title is raised each year, and this did not meet it for me.

I was anticipating this game for a while, I did not watch everything about it up to release date, but I kind of regret purchasing it. At best its a rental, or wait for the sequel and hope its better.

review:
All in all a good game. In my opinion - it felt like playing the first Assassins Creed. It feels a little repetitive, especially all the side quests. I think Watch_Dogs has a great potential as a new franchise. The story is absolutely amazing, Chicago looks beautiful, and I really love the sound design and score (the radio music - not so much).
In my case it helped a lot on performance to install TheWorse's graphic mod - and the graphics went from great to stunning. 

A lot of the gameplay mechanics works very well, and a lot of missions can really be accomplished with differnt tactics. It's an interesting and immersive world. And still after many hours of gameplay, my heartbeat rises the moment another player is trying to hack me (online).

For me the game has been worth every penny, mainly because of a great main story. I really look forward to see more of the Watch_Dogs universe. This has been a great gaming experience. Now back to Goat Simulator.

review:
Hace un mes y medio (no tengo tiempo para más) estuve "defendiendo" a Watch Dogs de una mano de "gamers" que el mismo día de su salida ya estaban hablando de que no cumpliria sus expectativas por una seria de motivos absolutamente absurdos (practicamente todos ellos eran técnicos, inclusive el reflejo de las ventanas de los edificios que no es real WTF!!!), la verdad es que después de un mes y pico jugando intermitentemente el juego está por desgracia muy por debajo de GTAV, ya sabemos que los medios no son los mismos, que han tenido muchos problemas blablabla... Hay un sin fin de pequeñas maravillas y genialidades en este juego, pero también hay muchísimos errores claros que hacen que todo lo demás valga mucho menos de lo que debería de valer 6/10

ACTUALIZACIÓN

Ha sido al final, pero hay 2 factores fundamentales en WD que lo combierten en un juego genial o en un juego ramplón que no pasa del 6/10 para mi, fundamentalmente son de rendimiento y gráficos, la jugabilidad de este juego también está bastante comprometida a veces, pero hay veces en la que es todo lo contrario, a mi modo de verlo es un juego con una sola forma buena de hacer las cosas, y es entender de que "pelotas" va el juego, una vez que te metes en la dinamica y lo piensas tal y como está parido para pensarlo, el juego es una maravilla absoluta de fluidez y genialidad, pero eso sí "dentro de lo que tienes que pensar y hacer".

Alguno entenderá la hiperchorrada que acabo de escribir, pero a lo que iba.

Después de ponerlo en modo "SIN BORDES" y volverlo a poner en "PANTALLA COMPLETA" el juego ya gana 1/10 de puntuación de golpe. Pero es una verguenza que eso tenga que ser así. Muy mal Ubisoft por dar lugar a esta solución ramplona para mejorar el juego. Punto 2 también muy importante el E3 MOD, es algo así como convertir un "quiero y no puedo" por parte de Ubisoft en aquel juego con el que nos enamoraron en los gameplay, para mi forma de verlo casi--casi--el mismo que nos presentaron y con el que nos arrancaron la pre-compra que tanto nos picó después. Eso sí, pensad en que para disfrutar de este juego hace falta tener equipo, con 2 680 en SLI un 3820 500gb de SSD y 24Gb a 2133... se mueve bien, pero no hace palmas. 

8.8/10

review:
I thought it was a great game i had no problems except if i would play for a while it would start to lag so i had to simply restart it. 

I recomend making a ubisoft account ( if you dont already have one) before you start playing. Also that you check your computer specs before purchasing this game so you dont waste your money if you PC can not handle it. 

Other than that it was a fun/good game.

お散歩ゲー
いい意味でストーリーが進みません
ストーリーがつまらないと言うわけではないのですが色んな所で日の出を見たり人々の情報を垣間見たりするのが楽しすぎます。
そうskyrimのmod入れたらストーリーが進まくなるのお散歩バージョンですね

なので現在25時間ほどやっているのですがストーリーはまだ半分ほどしか...

そして以外に面白かったのがオンライン
侵入側では周りをくるくる回って自分を探しているのを見るの楽しく
される側では隠れる人を探して気づかれない用にどう殺そうかと考えるのが楽しい

いままで褒めてますがもちろん悪い点もあります。
・カーチェイス時相手は助手席の奴が銃を撃ってくるのにこちらは撃てない。
・マウス加速強制ON
・Farcryの塔みたいなのがあって面倒くさい
・modを入れないとグラフィックが糞でお散歩も楽しくない

これらの悪い点も含めて自分は楽しいと思いました。

追記
先ほどクリアしました。現在プレイ時間は52時間です。

なので現在25時間ほどやっているのですがストーリーはまだ半分ほどしか...

そして以外に面白かったのがオンライン
侵入側では周りをくるくる回って自分を探しているのを見るの楽しく
される側では隠れる人を探して気づかれない用にどう殺そうかと考えるのが楽しい

いままで褒めてますがもちろん悪い点もあります。
・カーチェイス時相手は助手席の奴が銃を撃ってくるのにこちらは撃てない。
・マウス加速強制ON
・Farcryの塔みたいなのがあって面倒くさい
・modを入れないとグラフィックが糞でお散歩も楽しくない

これらの悪い点も含めて自分は楽しいと思いました。

review:
Truthfully I am sick of terrible reviews just complaining about Uplay, this review is going to be about Watch_Dogs, not Uplay. This game to me was over-hyped before it came out so when it did, a lot of people got let down. But, the game is still a very enjoyable game, it may not be as good as we expected to be but it is still an amazing game for me at least. The graphics are still quite impressive, and the idea is original. Here are some pros and cons,

PROS:
Great Visuals and Graphics
Fun to explore the city of Chicago
Good AI system
Great Storyline
Hacking is fun
Map Size is Pretty Good

CONS:
Driving isn't exactly bad, its just not too realistic, so i'm not sure if this would be a CON, but its not PRO
The Hacking Puzzles annoy me, but they aren't hard at all, just feel like a waste of time

I also heard a ton of complaints that the game was terribly optimized, I understand that it may not be as optimized as it could be but I also feel that a lot of people just do not have the graphics card to run this type of graphics, and I bet they couldn't run other visually amazing games like Crysis 3 or Battlefield 4. Not saying this is the case with all of the people complaining (I use Nvidia therefore I cannot speak for the AMD users as I heard it was not as well Optimized for those graphics cards). But I use a Geforce GTX 860M and I run the game on High with 40 FPS or so. The graphics card is not too expensive so I think some people just need to upgrade for certain games instead of blaming the gaming industry for getting better graphics. So overall I rate this game 10/10 to be honest, I know many people do not share this opinion but I personally really enjoyed this game.

review:
To get the basics out of the way: Is it a good game? Yes. Did it live up to the hype? No, but nothing really every does fully meet the hype around it. Does Ubisoft suck for nerfing it? Yes. Does Uplay still suck? Duh. Is it worth getting? Yes. 

Very quickly I could reconize that this game was made by Ubisoft. If you look at their two flagship series (IMO) Assassins Creed and Far Cry, its very obvious, and almost too simular. You climb towers/buildings to unlock "vision" in an area, a variety of "main" sidequests and then others that are fairly irrelivant (i.e. Hard drives in WD and the little statues in FC3), half way through the game money isn't a problem, even T-Bone and Hurk are one and the same between the games. The same goes for assassins creed mechanics, but I played Far Cry 3 more recently so its easier to draw the comparisons to Far Cry 3. All in all, the mechanics are very simular between the games, so much so that they just feel the same, like clones of each other. And if they are copying so much over from other games, I expect that would be very refined, and it isn't, but that brings me to my next point. 

The mechanics of the game are awful, they really hinder from having a good, fun, and fullfilling emersive experience. The game almost requires a controller over keyboard/mouse due to the driving and stealth mechanics. I get that it is very hard to overcome with a keyboard and mouse, but it really feels like they didn't even try, the controls are just awful. Next, the thrid person camera doesn't track properly, expecially when driving. It can sometimes be the most difficult aspect of fighting a enemy. But lets go back to the driving mechanics for one moment, and I this also ties into the A.I. as well. How is it when I am in the fastest car in the game, a police SUV and catch up to me? Or how they won't break the law and won't drive on a sidewalk, but running people over to try to push me into a wall is completely fine? The morality of the A.I. in the game is laughable, and when a game revolves this much around morallity, it needs to be spot on to not be a joke, which it is. Speaking of fighting... it isn't horrible. You have the typical stealth vs run and gun and everywhere in between (like other Ubisoft games, go figure). One sometimes can't kill the person, they have to "take down" the enemy, although they don't make it very clear whether or not one is allowed to just kill an enemy, which can be frustrating. The enemies are also blind as a bat, which I guess is added in there to make it easier, but the vision system is still poorly done, especially compared to Ubis other games. All in all, most of the mechanics are at least slightly broken, some of them just about ruin the game (like driving) but for the most part they aren't bad enough to ruin the game completely, as you can see by how many hours I racked up. 

They story is pretty good. Voice acting is very strong, and so are the personalities. I would have liked T-Bone to be around earlier in the game for good comedic relief, but thats very minor. But, everything was predictable (which is what makes a good story nowanddays), which I saw coming, but even still, there was no suprise or shock left in it, nothing really got at my emotions. I did enjoy making the choice at the end (again, very similar to FC3, come on Ubi, diversify, you can do it!) so I am glad they included that. The story was good, worth at least two play throughs, Jordi really made it for me, I just wish he had a bit more comedy (or a chance to entertain in place of T-Bone) but still, a good and worthwhile story. 

The online I didn't play much of because I can't stand it, its terrible IMO. Wasn't worth messing with. 

Side-quests and mini games: I don't really care for the mini-games and digital trips, but thats just me. The fixer contracts for the most part were fun, others very frustrating (and in a bad way, its no like they made it difficult, it was just a lack of refinement. Things that could have been ironed out but weren't) but for the most part a possitive experience. That various gang side missions were fun, they were enjoyable and well done, they had a range of enviroments to make it a fresh experience everytime. 

Would I recommend this game? Obiviously, yes, thats what I voted on. It may seem like I am really down on the game, but thats just because Ubisoft backed themselves into a corner in a lot of ways. Its fun, worth a play through or two, but it could have been so much better with just a little bit of refinement around the edges. It makes me sad to see the potential in the game compared to what it is. That being said, its a good game, but should be a great one.

review: the only thing enjoyable after the first 10 mins of this game are the graphics, but even they need work and are unfinished.  Save your money and buy GTA because they are already releasing DLC for this unfinished game at a price.  Uplay IS A JOKE.... you spend 60 percent of the time hacking camera to camera  (motion sickness much) other than that, the story is somewhat unique and it puts you in a world filled with people glued to their cellphones. it is a beautiful game at a distance but when you dig deeper it reveals its ugly head. I hate to bash games because I dont have near as much talent as the creators on this one, but i bought this game and stopped playing it after a week because of repetative tasks and annoying multiplayer. wait for it to go on sale and try it for yourself :)

review: Good game, I personally prefered it over GTA since you actually get to be a "good guy" rather than a mindless ape for a change. Nothing more satisfying than putting a round between a human trafficker's eyes. Still, the game has serious faults. I have literally played the game three times now since it keeps crashing and deleting my save (you only get one save) and the graphics showcased at E3 in 2012 are a lie, its about on par with any other open world game at the moment. If you want those original graphics that were awesome and blew your brain mind, you'll have to wait for a mod to get finished that is meant to reactivate the graphics options (including reduced screen tear and stuttering) that were LOCKED inside of the game. Then again, what else is new in the world of "we can't afford to have Microsoft and Sony upset at lost sales due to consoles = low-end PC's..." Really people... a good PC will cost only 100 more than a Console and beat the pants off of them too (not to mention in the long run you save a fortune). Until people learn this, we'll all keep getting gimped on content and capability. Unfortunately, while Watch Dogs was fun, it is THE example of what is wrong with a console focused community (No, you don't get to like both :P ).

review:
Не будем никого обманывать,  все знают что Watch_Dogs  это   ГТА, но это не вся правда, ГТА лучше.
    Я не хочу говорить что ВД плохая игра, она хороша, но поверхностно:   Годный сюжет, Неплохая детализация, хорошее освещение, отличные погодные эфекты (особенно дождь и лужи на асфальте), необычная идея со взломами, множество  мини игр (кроме шахмат, кто играл поймёт).    Но всё это теряеется на фоне недостатков:  кривая физика и разрушаемость объектов (особенно в плане вождения и всё что с этим связано), однотипные задания, одинаковые убежища, один костюм на все случаи жизни к которому покупаешь "краску".   Вся эта шаблонность уже после  часа игры начинает вызывать раздражения,  В местах развлечения ВД чикаго  можно либо  напиться в стельку, либо  поиграть в тупые шахматы, где дискатеки, стриптиз или просто какие нибудь шоу ?....нет этого.  В общем одна сплошная печаль, ведь разработчики  делали  игру под ГТА неужели нельзя было   стащить  побольше фишек?  нет, продолжают делать Ассасинс Крид.  Из приятного на десерт, порадовал мультиплеер, особенно слежка и внезапные вторжения это безусловно добовляет игре огромный плюс и скрашивает убогий сингл.  В итоге могу сказать что игра не плохая и не хорошая, она сырая, стоит ли в неё играть решать конечно же вам.

review:
Assez déçu de ce jeu.
Je ne suis pas déçu comme certains à cause des graphismes mais plus au niveau du gameplay.
Au final pour moi ce jeu est comme un Assassin's Creed. Il est excellent pour ce qui adorent le jeu et le côté extrêmement rébarbatif.
Perso je trouve le jeu sympa mais on a vite fait le tour de faire mumuse avec son téléphone portable et les conséquences reste les mêmes.
On peut noter une bonne durée de vie si on a l'ambition de finir le jeu à fond mais bon comme n'importe quel open world avec des objets à collecter.
Points positifs:
- Gameplay hacker assez fun mais devient vite lassant
- Durée de vie
- Gunfight & Infiltration
- Possible interraction avec d'autres joueurs en ligne dans sa partie
- Un open world assez vaste

Points négatifs:
- Mal optimisé graphiquement (mal optimisé ca ne veut pas dire qu'il est pas beau graphiquement.)
- Pas d'arme possible en voiture..
- Scénario
- Manque de véhicule (skate & co)

review:
GTAシリーズ、Saints RowシリーズやJust Causeシリーズのような、いわゆるオープンワールドクライム・アクションゲーム。
　上に挙げた３つのゲームをどれかひとつでも積んでる人はこのゲームも積む可能性が大きいので注意。
　どれもやったことない！という人は、このゲームよりも上に挙げたゲームのほうがお勧めなので、そっちをプレイしたほうがいいと思う。
　
　この手のゲームはよくあるけれど、Saints Rowには変態コスプレ変態プレイなどのギャグ要素が特徴としてあり、Just Causeにはすさまじく広大なマップとフックを利用した爽快な移動やアクションがあり、これらの特徴が大きな魅力となっていた。
　では、このゲームが他にない要素はというと、ハッキングくらいしかないわけだが、これがすごく地味。そこら辺に歩いてる人の個人情報（性犯罪歴があるとか）を盗み見たり、監視カメラの映像を盗み見たり、爆発物を遠隔から勝手に爆破したり等々。
　そのせいか、ミッションやサブミッションの内容が、ありきたりなカーチェイスや敵殲滅など大して面白くないものばかりになってしまっている。特に、飛行機に乗れないのが痛い。せめて、ストーリーが映画のように面白ければ救われるのだが、これもありきたりな展開とキャラクターで退屈な内容になってしまっている。

　けして悪いゲームではないが、先に挙げたオープンワールドゲームより高く評価することはできない。ただし、全体的に水準は高いレベルにあるのでGTAタイプのゲームが大好きな人であれば、十分に満足はできるだろう。
　この手のゲームが別に嫌いじゃないって程度の人でもセールで10＄未満であれば十分買いだと思う。

review:
Игра супер  !!!!!

Самая крутая играаааа мира 2014 года !!!

Круче даже gta 5 !

[b]STORYLINE:[/b] I enjoyed the storyline to this game very much. It was a bit confusing at first trying to keep up with all the characters involved since there were so many involved. Many folks suggest the storyline is cliché and over used but I found it to be quite immersive and at times, very emotional. I will admit the story seems to be a tad bit short for my taste as completing the game seemed to happen a bit too quickly…and I’m usualy bad about dragging a games story out for a long time before losing interest and never finishing.

[b]GAMEPLAY:[/b] Gameplay was spot on although I do wish more of the environment was able to be interacted with. The promise of dynamic movement by “jumping over fences or running through buildings” was cut short by limiting the areas in which these actions could be performed. The options that were given to the player were by all means fun and definitely provided many hours of wreaking havoc but just felt like I was being limited. Once the campaign is completed there seems to be a major lack of replay value as the only choices given to players is to either play solely online contracts or to delete their game and start a new one.

[b]MULTIPLAYER:[/b] The transition between offline and online gameplay is near seamless which amazes me to this day. The ability to have another player join your game with NEARLY no warnings is something I’ve personally never experienced in any games I’ve ever played. I know I’m biased due to my lack of variety of games I’ve played, so take that opinion with a grain of salt. Unfortunately there are a few tell tale signs of a player entering your game and once you (or the other player if you’re joining their game) know those signs, it tends to ruin the stealth style of gameplay that was trying to be achieved. The multitude of online game modes is enjoyable but can get old rather quickly. Free Roam seems to be a clusterf*ck of killing only, with no real point other than to just kill other players with no rewards or penalties. Online Tailing, Online Hacking, and Online Decryption seem to be the most enjoyable modes but deal their own faults. The inability to hack/tail your friends in particular (even if no rewards were given due to possible exploiting) is a major disappointment. Online Racing is rather fun most of the time although laggy players will always be the bane of the game as you feel you’ve stepped into a scene from the movie, “Jumper”, watching a rivals car jump around the street and through obstacles.

[b]GRAPHICS:[/b] I personally felt most of the games graphics were spot on with very few instances to complain about. I do encounter slight choppy framerates when in high speed escapes/chases and have crashed every so often during such situations so optimization might still be a bit of an issue. The game runs rather nicely on a mid-range PC with graphics settings near maxed out (high on most settings) excluding the common stuttering problem stated above. I cannot chock the crashing to graphics so I don’t count that against it. The game has wonderful graphics and is definitely outputting some eye candy in my opinion but there is a large following of players that are HIGHLY disappointed that the graphics do not match the quality that was shown to them in the pre-release E3 trailers.

[b]FINAL NOTES:[/b] I loved Watch_Dogs and recommend it to friends daily for the fun gameplay and immersive storyline. If you can deal with a game that still has a few bugs to work out, and is in need of some serious DLC or additional content….you might want to give this game a try. I’d give it 3.5 out of 5 stars but only due to lack of content and slight optimization problems. Hopefully Ubi will put out some more updates with additional content to help spice up the game in the near future…..especially since they offered a “season pass” for purchase.

review:
Watch_Dogs não é um jogo ruim nem nada assim, mas ele teve 5 anos de produção, e entre esse tempo foi gerada muita propaganda, trailers que prometiam trazer um jogo simplesmente perfeito para os usuários.
Em torno de tantas promessas o game veio a 127 reais e sem cumprir com o que foi prometido..
Falhas com algumas placas de vídeo, o som extremamente bugado, com o volume baixo e bugs:
Virou moda hj em dia lançar jogo em pré-alfa, o jogo ta longe de ser finalizado e os produtores já botam em pré-order..
Watch_Dogs foi um jogo que teve 5 anos pra ser produzido, repensado, ser corrigido e mesmo assim veio lotado de bugs, falhas de programação e etc..
O jogo não vale o preço que tem.. Fizeram tanto marketing do jogo em vão.. deixaram muita a desejar em um jogo que poderia e estava sendo o mais esperado do ano.. cagaram tudo.. Como eu disse antes, nao é um jogo ruim, a história não é tão envolvente mas é uma história boa, tem tudo pra ter sau continuação, mas tem que melhorar muita coisa, se não será somente outra decepção para os jogadores.. Se não fosse o preço alto eu recomendaria o jogo com certeza, mas ele não vale o que está sendo proposto..

review:
Game crashes to desktop after about 5 mins of play although my system meets the minimum requirements. I went through a month of following automated help desk messages after I opened a ticket with Ubisoft ("Send us your dxdiag info, delete save games and so on) until they finally said that they can't help me and that I'd have to weait for a patch which I don't expect to ever appear.

About the gameplay (as far as I could play): Can't tell you about the story as I didn't get past the 2nd mission, yet the hacking possibilities in that stage of the game seem rather simple: Switch traffic lights, open draw bridges, blow up steam pipes, maybe two or three more. But you get to see them quite soon and I guess there isn't much after that.
Also, you never see any cops around (even when driving over people and causing general mayhem) until you break any scripted "laws" which causes them to spawn all of a sudden and swarm all over you. I think we've all seen other open world games (GTA series) which have been doing better at this years before this was released.
Horrible game, and very confusing. Driving is terrible. I have two Nvidia 680's and still cant play on ultra settings. Dont buy this game

review:
Игра и качество в целом- 4/10- игра анонсирована в 2012, выход должен был состояться осенью 2013, релиз перенесли на полгода.Игра вышла забагованной.Например, ты пробираешься в стелсе через толпу врагов, и тут перед тобой спавнится два самых сильных соперника у которых из обычного оружия(которым стреляют все боты) выходит повышенный в два-три раза урон и из-за них тебя обнаруживают и они же тебя и убивают, и тебе опять 10 минут нужно проходить эту же миссию.

Машины и их физика- 3\10 - три балла только за то, что выбор машин более-менее велик и за то, что они хоть как-то ездят. А вот физика машин худшая из всех игр, в которые я когда-либо играл. Клаксон добавлен в игру просто так, боты и машины на него вообще не реагируют.

ИИ- 5\10 - окружающий мир местами нравится, отображаются жизненные ситуации и т.п., но местами просто бесит, боты сами бросаются под машину, сами в тебя врезаются. Была ситуация, что вооруженный боец при обнаружении меня, подходит и начинает орать, тупо ОРАТЬ, как ебаный пещерный человек, издавать примитивные звуки, это пиздец, прикиньте если бы в реальной жизни солдаты так воевали, лол.

Графика - 6\10 - графика более-менее. Конечно не Е3 2012(юбики пиздливые псы), но всё же. Местами бывают приступы Ваномаса. И да, системные требования-это пиздец, даже батла 4 не такая привередливая, а если сравнить эти две игры, то батла явно натягивает ВД

Геймплей- 6\10 -игра с телефоном начинает надоедать в середине игры, через миссию идёт погоня, где нужны заскриптовано с помощью смартфона разбить машину об столб и т.п., кстати погони невыносимы за счет физики машин, за погоню ты убиваешь десять людей и взрываешь свою машину из-за столкновений

Короче, не рекомендую покупать, максимум можно скачать пираточку, поиграть и удалить это УГ. Тем более достижений нет и игра запускается через юплей.

review:
Что можно сказать об игре,давай-те по порядку,это творение от ubisoft я ждал долго,но не получил того что хотел,сюжет однообразный-хакни,убей,взломай,хакни,найди,взломай,но стоит упоминуть открытый мир в игре,это относительно спасает игру,все происходит динамично,Чикаго живет и процветает .Отдельное хочу сказать про персонажей,они колоритные,запоминающиеся,графика не оправдала моих ожиданий,но тем не менее хорошо вышло,если ещё взять не посредственные мисси,вышло даже очень хорошо.система взлома порадовала,плюс система прокачки,но с русской локализацие что-то не так,были какие-то иероглифы,проходилось запоминать
игра вышла хорошей,но не то что я хотел,ну и конечно оценки
за геймплей 8.5/10
за графику  9.3/10
за сюжет     7.2/10
советую хотя-бы скачать эту игру

review:
Лично для меня Watch_Dogs пока провал 2014 года. В 2012 году WD взорвала мне мозг, но сейчас спустя 2 года она не дает мне и 1/3 тех ощущений. Может тому вина GTA V или просто Ubisoft не вытянуло уровень на должном уровне? Ubisoft часто плохо делает первые игры своих франчайзов, пример тому Assassin's Creed. Сюжет игры не интересен, в Assassin's Creed IV Black Flag он вышел интересней. Музыка и звуки на удивление понравились, достойный плейлист. Графика не идеальна, даже на топовых машинах лагает. Движок сильно уступает RAGE. А ведь обновленный RAGE появился пока только на прошлом поколении консолей вместе с GTA V. Открытый мир о котором так много говорили Ubisoft - большой скучный и однообразный. Да, для игр Ubisoft этот мир прогресс, но он рядом не стоит с GTA V по проработке. Если игру не сравнивать с творением Rockstar то игра получилась отличной, если сравнивать, что приходится делать так и так, то Watch_Dogs слишком слаба. Просто WD вместо отличной игры оказалась проходняком
Моя оценка - 7.5/10

review:
Try to avoid it atleast until they optimize it more.
The game is fun, but it requires a powerhouse of a machine to run smoothly. Apart from that I would also say that Ubisoft hid the graphics from E3 so the game looks worse then it normally should. There is a mod out there to fix this, but the game will still just run like crap and be nigh on unplayable due to the fps drops.

review: The story line is pretty bad.   When I played the game, I didn't really care for the main character and what he had to do. Most missions are the same (run and gun or clear a room full of guards).  Also, you press Q the whole time trying to "hack" stuff.. it's more like activating than hacking.  I would only get this if it goes on sale ($40).

review:
Прошло довольно мноно времени с релиза игра,но только сейчас я решил написать свою рецензию.
Итак,приступим.

Плюсы игры(+):
+Сюжет(Да,сюжет довольно стандартен,но с каждой миссией вы продвигаетесь все в высшие слои населени и вершите правосудие).
+Графика.Не некст-ген,но графика очень приличная.Особенно на максимальных настройках.
+Взаимодействие с миром.Довольно интересно взламывать светофоры,ограждения,заборы и ворота и т.д.,а так же с помощью своего телефона изучать людей(и убивать,если кто-то тебе не понравился :D )
+Неплохой выбор оружия.
+Система репутации.(Расстрел прохожих на право и на лево плохо скажется для вас).

А теперь к грустной части.
- Завышенные системные требования.У людей со средним железом будет лагать.
-Однообразность,хотя в игре очень много заданий,но все они сводятся к одному(Убей,догони,взломай)
-Отсутствие возможности управления воздушным транспортом(на вертолете не полетать :( )
-Ближнего боя как такового нет,только из пушек стреляй.
-Физика машин(столкновений и т.д.) оставляет желать лучшего...
-Посредственный мультиплеер(с друзьями особо не поиграть).
Возможно это не все,ибо обзор писался на скорую руку.
Итог: Несмотря на подавляющее количество недостатков я считаю,что игра достойна покупки,хотя бы для того,что бы оценить ее самому.

review:
My first impressions of [i]Watch_Dogs[/i] were negative. The game performed very poorly, there was a noticeable downgrade in graphical fidelity compared to what was shown to the public in E3 2012, the plot seemed uninspired and the protagonist was the dullest and most hypocritical character I had ever seen.

Despite it all, I decided to stick with it and play the game to completion. I finished the main story missions, side missions and bonus missions that came with the Deluxe Edition.

There's no doubt that there's enough content here to justify the price. [i]Watch_Dogs[/i]' rendition of Chicago is huge and feels alive, and there is plenty to see and do. In addition to the aforementioned missions, there are numerous minigames such as poker, chess, drinking games and the great "digital trips", adding an element of fun to the otherwise serious tone of the game. Among these so-called "trips" is a mode in which you control a gigantic mechanical spider armed with a minigun and missile turrets, and your goal is to wreak as much havoc as possible.

There's a healthy blend of action and stealth segments, and the ability to cause major blackouts and to "hack" almost anything in the city to change the landscape of the battlefield in your favor adds a very interesting layer of depth to the solid gameplay mechanics that can be found here. However, all of these powers can make the game too easy at times.

My complaints regarding performance persist. I can deal with less than 60 frames per second. What I can't deal with is the severe stuttering that occurs randomly every now and then, as it greatly affects my enjoyment, especially during car chase sequences, often causing me to run over pedestrians.

And that leads me to another complaint I mentioned in the first paragraph. The protagonist, Aiden Pearce, is supposed to be a "vigilante", ever watchful of wrongdoings. However, he sees no problem in sacrificing innocent civilians to achieve his own goals. He might travel to the other side of the city to stop an armed robbery, but he'll kill at least five cancer patients, charity workers, newlyweds etc. on his way there without much consequence. Sure, your "street rep" is decreased, and eventually someone might inform the police. But when all it takes to evade the cops is getting into a boat and sailing into the sunset (the police force has no boats), why bother? Also... those blackouts I mentioned? What about people in hospitals? What about all of those bank accounts I hacked to steal money from those same cancer patients? There's no in-game punishment, and your own morals can only carry you so far in a game.

On top of that, Aiden's voice actor clearly did not care for the character, either. He just sounds boring and bored.

As for the multiplayer component, I have to say, Ubisoft did an excellent job here. There are several modes to choose from, but by far the most compelling one is Online Hacking. In it, you "invade" a player's "world" and try to "steal data" from him. The target, once notified of the invasion, will have a limited amount of time to find and eliminate you. This is all integrated seamlessly into the single-player mode, which means at any given time (except during missions), another player might be  tracking your every movement, waiting for the perfect moment to act. This is optional, of course, so if you want a completely offline experience without interferences, you can have it. But it's such a fun game of cat-and-mouse, that I highly recommend you at least try it.

Regarding graphical fidelity, there's no question that even in max-settings, the game falls short of the visuals presented in the now infamous E3 2012 trailer. However, it does look great. Water effects, in particular, are probably the best I have ever seen in a game. There's a community-made "patch" that unlocks some hidden configuration settings for the graphics, while also reducing stuttering. It's called "TheWorse Mod", and at the time of this writing is still in version 0.8, but does the job well.

Fortunately I didn't run into any problems with uPlay, and managed to play the game offline when I needed to. Not everyone was as lucky, though, so Ubisoft's DRM system is something to keep in mind.

Overall, it's a very good game, hindered by a couple of serious technical flaws and lessened by a forgettable main character. I  do feel like the pros outweigh the cons, though, so I can safely give it a thumbs up.

review:
GTA-like open world game set in near-future Chicago
+ cool setting and main story line
+ hacking as an interesting concept of interacting with the world (e.g., hacking via hacked cameras)
+ vehicle pursuits offer interesting alternatives to take down enemies
+ nice in-game minigames (poker, AR video games, finding QR codes via cameras, etc)
- repetitive gameplay in side missions
- characters are a bit shallow
- resources (money, ammo) are too easy to get

Still a very underrated game imo

review:
Now let's start with the bad: yes Watch_Dogs has some serious performance issues on PC. If you are someone who absolutely cannot tolerate framerate stutter in their games you will NOT enjoy Watch_Dogs, With that said Ubisoft are working on a patch to solve this issue so keep in mind that this point might not be valid when you read this review. Now let's see what else there is... oh yeah and as of 10 hours into the game I am yet to find any dogs to watch. First Sleeping Dogs (which is amazing you should buy right now) and now this. Dat false advertising. 

But seriously this game got some baaaaad press when it came out and it most certainly earns its fair share of critisisms. Despite this though I find Watch_Dogs to be a pretty enjoyable open world game. If you can keep your expectations in check you should find this game to be well worth your money.

review:
This review was written just after finishing the main story. This is a great game, despite some technical flaws and having to put up with UPlay.

All in all, the story is good, despite the odd moments where you feel disconnected, but it does have a proper ending and build up, you end up liking the characters and being pulled in.

Gameplay is solid, gun fights flow well (Despite the AI being so cautious and aim-bot like) so you have some fun, the car chases are where the game shines, though eventually it becomes monotonous.

I'm interested to now go explore the side missions and see what the DLC has to offer.

In conclusion, great game, would reccomend.

In conclusion, great game, would reccomend.", "timestamp_created": 1404938137, "timestamp_updated": 1404938137, "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 1, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": "0.523809552192687988", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
I want to love this game the graphics the storyline. Everything i would love to  continue to play this game. However Ubi soft when i start playing it. You make me feel like i have waisted my money. I say this because of one simple flaw. Textures tuttering to the point  of unplayble. Ive done everything i possibly can to fix it. My system is what most would consider higher end gaming. Twin 670 FTWs 32 gigs of ram ssd in raid 0  6 core i7 processor. Yet, even with this rig i simply cantp lay it. I have tried all the textures on low and still when i drive stuttering tearing to the point where i thought the system was going to crash. I have overclocked my cards sent more power to them and simply nothing. Its a shame because I could really enjoy spending time in this game. Ubi soft or nividia please find a way to fix this game. For those of you considering to buy the game don't not unless you have 4 gigs of video ram or more to devote to the game.  

Please fix this game so i can give  it an honest review such a shame really. untill then  I can't help but feel i waisted my 50 bucks.

review:
It's Grand Theft Auto but with environmental perks. Game's okay. I suppose the game was overhyped (I didn't follow the game as much as everyone else, like Halo) and then blown to shit with the underrated ratings. It's not a bad game. Maybe I haven't played an open world game in a while and this is kind of refreshing. You're paying for another Hollywood action game if you want to look at it that way. In a sense, it is kind of like renting another blockbuster and just enjoying yourself. It's the next Liam Neeson movie. Also, if you like stalking people ... I mean following people's facebook statuses, you will probably enjoy this game. 

"Sounds and looks like a movie!" - Girlfriend

[b]Technical Issues[/b]
Uplay also works well for me, hasn't been an issue since the game was released. My laptop with an old nVidia card runs the game at low to medium settings at pretty good frame rates. My desktop runs the game at ultra settings at 30-60fps. After an hour of play, I think it starts hitting 15-44fps for some reason. 

[b]Pros[/b]
+ beautiful graphics (even before I made some changes for ultimate settings); environment, models, weather
+ voice acting is good, Jordi Chin is my favorite 
+ game runs really well
+ plenty of skills; hacking, driving, combat unlockables
+ plenty of side quests and stuff to do
+ explosions, hollywood film
+ multiplayer coop available, you can also wreck stuff for fun together
+ invade other players, earn more achievements
+ choose between hero of the public, or villain
+ random instances/crime occurences player can stop
+ become a millionaire doing NOTHING but pressing Q (hack people)
+ stalk people

[b]Cons[/b]
- story is typical drama
- driving controls aren't all too much to talk about
- short main story
- physics is weird, almost everything is destructible and your car is damn near invincible
- hacking is childsplay, press one button to hack or do a small puzzle to hack
- crimelords who want to remain "secret" and "private" have cameras everywhere, even in ghettos

Lets get hacking lets make some money and chaos ! See you on the streets!

review:
핸드폰과 해킹이라는 소재를 활용한 오픈 월드 액션 어드벤처 게임입니다. 플레이어는 핸드폰을 이용하는 다재다능한 해커가 되어, 도심속에서 자경단원으로 활동하며, 이야기를 펼쳐나가게 됩니다. 해킹을 통해, 데이터를 빼오는 것 뿐만 아니라, 가스 벨브를 폭파 시키거나, 지역을 정전시키는 등의 현대 사회에 어울리는 슈퍼 파워를 사용할 수 있게 됩니다. 탄탄한 스토리와 다양한 컨텐츠 그리고 멀티 플레이 경쟁 요소까지 완성도 높은 게임성을 보여 줍니다. 성장 요소부터 도전 요소 그리고 멋진 그래픽을 가진 작품입니다.

장점: 멋진 그래픽, 다양한 컨텐츠, 수많은 확장 요소(DLC)
단점: 약간 어려운 난이도(경찰 또는 추격 등 운전 관련 컨텐츠의 난이도가 높은 편)

Un bon jeu pour ce qui est du mode campagne , mais ensuite décçus par le multijoueur.. par exemple : capturer le fichier ou on retrouve beaucoup de lag et de cheaters. D'autres modes sont mis mais sont beaucoup moin bien que celui la... Mode course on y trouve beaucoup de cheaters qui se téléporte tout le long de la course.

6/10 ca reste un jeu où on peut passer du temps mais il ne dépassera pas la série GTA

review: What can i say about Watch Dogs, well for starters it's AWESOME! When i was playing it I felt so immersed and I had so much fun... however when I finished it I was done, that was it the story makes it what it is. So all I can say is saver the story but when you're done i doubt you'll play it again, but that depends on you I guess.

review: very good game! 4/5 my complaints are very mild, there are some graphics issues on the PC version (visual tearing or lighting bugs) which takes away from the immersion and rarely makes gameplay an issue. The driving in the game is also a bit tough at times which is only really annoying on motorcycles or when you accidentally mow down an NPC. As far as the good aspects go, the gunplay is fun and using hacking is fun as well, the story isnt ground breaking but hey! blow some sh*t up and you'll forgive that.

review:
Exelente game, tem um enredo original  e muito bom, também nos faz refletir um pouco sobre o futuro proximo. Na minha opnião a campanha é muito curta, poderia ser explorada mais, quanto ao modo mutiplayer é bem divertido, mas depois de um tempo se torna enjoativo mas isso são apenas pequenos detalhes para esse grande game!!! afinal quem nunca teve vontade de causar um apagão na cidade um click HAHAHA
9/10

review:
Score: 8.5/10

Overall great game with a decent story. The driving dynamics in this game are excellent, which is a pretty important factor in my book when you've got an open world game. If you expect this game to have an exact map of Chicago, then you'll be disappointed - but given to scale of the game it's a good effort.

Biggest cons of this game is the fact that it runs like sh#t... Any of those comments that say "well it's a next gen game" is a load of crap - this game was poorly optimized for the PC platform, end of discussion. I have an i7-970, with two GTX 580s in SLI and it struggles with this game on max settings. If you have an NVIDIA GPU, and you have GeForce Experience installed allow that to optimize the game setting for you.
watch out, doges

review:
เกมไม่ได้ห่วยเหมือนที่หลายคนๆด่าไว้ แต่ก็ไม่ได้ดีเท่าโฆษณาที่โม้ไว้ นี่คือรีวิวสั้นๆของเกมนี้ Watch_Dogs

ในยุคที่สมองกลควบคุมทุกอย่าง กล้องวงจรปิดทุกซอกมุม,ไฟฟ้าและประปา,ไฟจราจร,ท่อส่งแก๊ส,อุปกรณ์อิเล็กทรอนิกส์ทั้งหลาย,สัญญาญอินเตอร์เน็ตและโทรศัพท์ ทุกอย่างเชื่อมถึงกันหมด แล้วใครล่ะที่ควบคุมสมองกลเหล่านั้น? ผู้ที่สามารถควบคุมสมองกลนั้นได้ คือผู้ที่สามารถควบคุมเมืองชิคาโก้ทั้งเมืองได้เลย จริงมั้ย? 

เราจะได้รับบทเป็น Aiden Pearce อาศัยที่ชิคาโก้ ซึ่งกำัลังถูกควบคุมด้วยระบบ ctOS (Central Operating System = ระบบปฏิบัติการกลาง) ทำให้ทุกสิ่งทุกอย่างในเมือง (ที่กล่าวไว้ข้างบน) ถูกควบคุมด้วยระบบเพียงระบบเดียว Aiden มีความสามารถในการแฮ๊กไปควบคุมระบบ ctOS ได้อย่างสมบูรณ์ เขาสามารถเปลี่ยนระบบอำนวยความสะดวกต่างๆให้กลายเป็นอาวุธที่ศัตรูไม่มีวันคาดถึงได้ ด้วยการกดโทรศัพท์ของเขา เพียงครั้งเดียว...

ตามสไตล์เกมของค่าย Ubisoft ที่เริ่มมา Aiden จะยังไม่มีอะไรมาก แต่การเก็บเลเวลอัพสกิลต่างๆจะทำให้ Aiden มีความสามารถมากขึ้น ไม่ว่าจะด้านการแฮ๊ก,ด้านการขับขี่,ด้านการยิงปืนและต่อสู้ รวมถึงด้านการป้องกัน ซึ่งคุณไม่สามารถเลือกมันได้หมดในช่วงแรกๆ ทำให้แต่ละคนมีแนวทางที่ต่างกัน และแน่นอนว่า Watch_Dogs ได้ให้ทางเลือกในการทำภารกิจมากมาย ไม่ว่าจะถือปืนหนักๆไปยิงตรงๆ หรือค่อยๆฟาดให้สลบทีละคนแบบเงียบๆ หรือแทรกซึมเข้าไปแฮ๊กแล้วออกมาเหมือนว่าไม่มีอะไรเกิดขึ้น คุณสามารถเลือกได้ตามใจคุณเลย

ภารกิจหลักของเกม Watch_Dogs เหมือนว่าจะน้อย แต่ภารกิจเสริมต่างๆนั้นมีเยอะเลยทีเดียว ซึ่งคุณจะไม่ทำมันก็ได้ แต่ถ้าคุณทำก็จะเป็นการสั่งสมประสบการณ์ให้กับ Aiden หรือเป็นการเก็บเงินไปซื้อปืนเทพๆ ชุดสวยๆ รถหรูๆ แล้วแต่คุณจะชอบ แต่ภารกิจเสริมบางอย่าง เช่นการปลดล็อคระบบ ctOS ในเขตต่างๆ นั้นคุณจะถูกบังคับให้ทำ เพื่อให้คุณสามารถดำเนินเนื้อเรื่องต่อไปได้นั่นเอง

แผนที่ของเกมนี้ยังไม่ใหญ่มากนัก แต่มี "ของเล่น" ให้คุณไว้แฮ๊กเล่นตลอดทางแน่นอน หรือจะเอาของเล่นเหล่านี้ไว้จัดการกับโจรกระจอกที่วิ่งราวทรัพย์ชาวบ้านก็ได้นะ  Watch_Dogs ได้ให้ืทางเลือกมาแล้ว ว่าคุณจะเป็น "วีรบุรุษศาลเตี้ย" ที่คอยช่วยเหลือผู้บริสุทธิ์และจัดการกับโจรแทนกฎหมาย หรือจะเป็น "จอมโจรอำมหิต" ที่ฆ่าคนแบบไม่เลือก ปล้นทุกเศษเงินที่เห็น ทางเลือกเหล่านี้ผมไม่แน่ใจนะว่าส่งผลกับตอนจบหรือเปล่า แต่จะส่งผลกับพฤติกรรมของ NPC ในเกมนี้แน่นอน

Watch_Dogs ไม่มีเครื่องบินหรือฮอให้ขับหรอกนะ มีแค่รถกับเรือเท่านั้น ทำให้อาจจะไม่อิสระเท่าเกม Open World ชื่อดังที่ยังไม่ลง Pc ในตอนนี้หรอก และก็ยังเทียบกันไม่ติดอีกด้วย (เกมไหนเหนือกว่าไปคิดเอาเองล่ะกันนะ) แต่โดยรวมแล้ว ถ้าไม่อคติมากเกินไป หรือไม่แฟนบอยมากเกินไป เกม Watch_Dogs ก็ถือว่าเป็นเกมที่ "ดี" อีกเกมนึงเลย แต่อย่างที่บอกว่ายังไม่ดีเท่าที่โม้ไว้แค่นั้นเอง

เรื่อง Multiplayer ขอเว้นไว้ก่อนล่ะกันนะ เพราะตั้งแต่เกมออกมา ยังไม่ได้เล่นเลย (Ubisoft Server Error ตลอด) เพราะฉะนั้นแล้ว ขอมอบคะแนนให้ Watch_Dogs 7/10 "ดีแล้ว แต่ยังดีกว่านี้ได้แน่นอน"

เรื่อง Multiplayer ขอเว้นไว้ก่อนล่ะกันนะ เพราะตั้งแต่เกมออกมา ยังไม่ได้เล่นเลย (Ubisoft Server Error ตลอด) เพราะฉะนั้นแล้ว ขอมอบคะแนนให้ Watch_Dogs 7/10 "ดีแล้ว แต่ยังดีกว่านี้ได้แน่นอน"", "timestamp_created": 1405039649, "timestamp_updated": 1405039763, "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 5, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": "0.601449251174926758", "comment_count": 1, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
Good Game. GTA Style Play with A Twist. Not quite as Intricate as it appears to be but nonetheless glad I purchased it as soon as I did. Still haven't beaten it yet, spending alot of time just exploring and doing side missions. Very Good Graphics. It's true what they say about a shitty soundtrack but that's easy to rectify. 

Worth it if you enjoy the open world experience.

review:
A buggy broken mess. This game crashed more frequently and more catastrophically than Skyrim, and I play Skyrim with 134 mods. Your save games will get corrupted. You will lose progress. It will crater at the most inconvenient spots. If you're incredibly lucky, you may be able to recover some of that lost time. But the biggest challenge in this game is enduring the constant bugs, crashes and data loss.

And don't expect UbiSoft to care. If their cloud service eats your games, their recommended fix is to not use their cloud service in favour of a third party program like Dropbox. Their first "patch" fixed performance issues by hobbling the rendering, and they haven't addressed the crashes at all. The only patch they've released since is a DLC patch for "new content" (read: pre-order bonuses repackaged as fresh content).

The plot is supposed to be a cautionary tale about overdependence on integrated technology, but the bigger lesson I learned is that you can't demand a refund for inferior products you buy on a digital platform. The true villains of this game are the PC porting team. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

Did not live up to the hype. After 8 hours I found myself bored and out of things to do. The story is extremely dull and the most fun I had was uninstalling this glitchy mess. Overall a waste of 60 bucks.

3/10 DO NOT BUY!

EDIT:
I just launched it and played it for a few minutes and suprisingly.......ITS STILL BAD!

review: Наконец прошел игру. Не буду заморачиваться и писать, что большей части запланированных ништяков не было, все и так знаем про это. Чтож, стоив бы игруля 400-450 рублей, я бы сказал, что за все эти деньги все супер, НО она стоит касарь и за такие бабки каждый касяк как удар под дых. Управление машинами дурацкое, но привыкаешь. Геймпад работает только от бокса, что не есть хорошо. Эйден Пирс довольно неинтересный персонаж, переживать за такого морально урода не хочется, но и любви как к антигерою к нему нет. Но финал впринципе понравился, в плане мятежа и новой системы. Но финал для Эйдана полная чушь. И самое главное у меня мощный комп, но от этой игры регулярно были экраны смерти. У меня были вирусы, как от пиратской версии, что за хрень? Я проиграл в игре 92 часа, прошел все второстепенные задачи (только qr коды 2 не собрал ибо там хз и не собрал все 100 отметок). Уходить от погони класно, метро тоже не за зря сделали, скрыватсья тоже интересно, взламовать прикалывает, какой никакой но бесошвный мультик тоже пристутсвет. Вообщем ко второй части юбики уберут все ошибки и поменяют главного героя и игра станет намного достойней. Я бы поставил игре лайк, но эти Экраны смерти были ужасны.

review: Tolles Spiel. Watch Dogs bietet eine schön gemachte Spielwelt, mit sehr viel liebe für´s Detail. Die Grafik ist Super und der Multiplayer-Modus ist eine nette Idee, die aber noch Ausbaufähiger wäre. In Watch Dogs gibt es viele kleine Nebenmissionen, die zwar zu beginn ganz gut sind, aber da sie sich im Kern wiederholen, werden sie auf Dauer auch etwas langweilig. Die Story in Watch Dogs ist aber einfach nur Klasse, man findet sich sehr schnell zu recht und fiebert regelrecht mit seinem Charakter mit.

review:
Me encanta ubisoft y Me encanta ente juego, a pesar de un par de errores y detalles minimos (como los reflejos), es muy entretenido y la historia y jugabilidad atrapantes. 
La gente tiene que dejar de compararlo con un gta. GTA es gta, y el watch dogs es watch dogs. 
Un juego no es bueno por las graficas. Deal with it.

review: 이때까지 해본게임중에서 크라이시스3말고는 최고의 그래픽게임이었습니다. 해킹이라는 소재인게 너무 좋았고, 해킹으로 도시 지형이나 물건들을 무기로 삼아서 싸우는것도 인상적이었습니다. 그래픽 하향이라는 소문이 있었지만 하향이 되었어도 이정도 그래픽이면 아주 볼만합니다. 아쉬운건 좀 최적화가 안 되어 있다는 것이고, 이미 지난일이지만 시디키같은 사건만 빼면은 완벽합니다.

review: Excellent game.  I have almost 30 hours of just single player mode in this game and it was well worth the money.  Story takes a little bit to get going, but once you get the ball rolling its packed with creative, action packed missions.  There are plenty of ways to take down your enemies.  Getting hacked / hacking random players is a nice twist too.  I'll be looking forward to future DLC and hopfully a second Watch Dogs.

review:
Watch_Dogs is a fantastic hacking-based RPG with tons of things to do. The single-player campaign has a lot of mission variety, from driving, evading the po-po, eliminating all fixers, or just guiding people to safety. Most of the missions allows you some freedom to complete the objective; you can either stealth your way past all of the enemies, or just kill em all if you'd like. 

There's a skill circle, with points that you can earn from completing missions or leveling up, and although some of the unlockable skills are more novel than helpful, most of the skills are pretty good. You've got 4 skill types to level up: Hacking, Combat, Driving, and Crafting. Hacking skills allow you to gain access to street hacks and ATM hack boosts. Combat skills give you the ability to enhance your weapons, carry more explosives, or even take down enforcers (the strongest enemy type). Driving and Crafting have the fewest upgrades, which allow you to enhance your car skills, or craft explosives, ctOS scans, focus pills, and communication jammer. 

Money is pretty easy to come by, since you can just hack bank accounts pretty often. If you do find yourself run short on cash though, there are always some missions that grant you money as a reward to complete those missions.

There's also a few minigames here, and the best one is easily Spider-Tank. There's 4 minigames here labled as "Digital Trips," which essentially makes you hallucinate into a Matrix-like environment where you assume a role specific to the minigame. In Spider-Tank, you'll destroy everything as a massive mechanical spider. These are meant to be more humorous than serious, so it's a good depart from the often serious tone of the game's story.

There are a few kinks though, mainly you can escape most chases by just swimming, and some of the controls are a bit wonky. When I played the game, there was that infamous graphics issue, though even though that's still technically in effect, I got through most of the game without any issues (I played using a laptop nVidia GeForce graphics card, 16 GB RAM, and an i7 Haswell processor). 

Overall, I'd recommend this game because there's just so much to do, and it's mostly fun to do those things. Unfortunately, you can't watch any dogs, but as long as you can get by with some of the issues at the moment (patches are incoming!), there's plenty to like about this game!

review:
If you're not a fan of 3rd person controller based games then do not buy this for PC gaming.

The keyboard controls are horrid and there's no ability to switch to 1st person meaning it's an annoying task to just navigate around. I like the open world gameplay but it's just ruined (for me) by the obvious lack of finese a mouse/keyboard game should have.

I would recommend Deus Ex instead if you haven't played that, especially given the price.
just a mediocre game. but the story line was good well for me at least and you need to have a good rig to really appreciate its graphics without lags. 5/10 not worth paying $60

review: Oh, oh Ubisoft.I was expecting huge results from this game,but i expected something very dissapointing.The graphics were down graded to sh*t,and speaking about graphics it's a really bad optimized game even my 760 can't run it on medium without lag.The most stupidest thing is that it's really really awful for AMD users as even on low you will lag like hell.If you have a low end pc or even a high end and you think this is the best game and you want,then you're wrong.It's an awful game with a plot which is really nothing new avenging your niece?Wow,i thought it's something new,special,unique.Please don't buy this game it's hard for many people and laggy plus the cars feel the same.A good thing is that you can use the enviroment like Traffic lights,Switches etc to take down cops or thugs,but this game is really bad if you want to buy a open world game wait for GTA 5 to come out for pc.Don't buy this awful piece of crap.And Ubisoft even needs to shut down Uplay and if you buy this game on steam you need Uplay what is this?Steam is the best, no need for any others.

review:
I thumbed this game up for what it offered and the experience, not for unoptimization or complaints about uplay. I wish I can have a thumb that goes in between. Because I thought the game was decent and just good, not great or game breakingly innovative but a good experience to play.

To start off you play as Aiden pearce who is a hacker and a vigilante one at that. He was hacking on a job when he called it quit causing a tragedy to happen. You'll have to play to understand. The game offers some decent storytelling that was worth playing for the experience, though is very linear in terms of choices and paths you can pick and decide.You can only choose some choices to be  good or evil in what you do which doesn't really alternate too much of the storyline at all.

The game is an openworld roaming with the gameplay involving alot of stealth and  cover shooting mechanic with the ability to hack thrown in  which can be fun and quite entertaining until it becomes a bit repetitive. Literally you can open a phone look at someone and as long as a person has a device on them you'll see thier information appear which is completely randomized, which can be quiteinteresting. The missions has plenty of missions you can take on which can be repetitive and the main storyline mission and not much more than that, the game has a good experience but didn't offer meatier content.. There is limited parkouring and climbing you can do but you cannot jump in this game which drives me infuckingsane  (in one of my video going for a top of the ledge(see bottom). The game itself has a nice leveling system set up in a way so that you can unlock new abilities that you progress enabling cooler and better hack. They are cool but the idea wears out after you unlocked the last one. Aside from that you can also craft items that will aid you in your missions.

The graphics are decent but the physics to the game felt very i and too solid. The texture itself can be pretty at some area but downright horrible in other areas along with poor optimization and locked graphical enhancements. Also with mod you can get a more stable play of the game + graphics that was shown to you at E3.

The multiplayer in the game is really intresting, as long as the game is set public people can basically invade you during the game anytime they want and once that happens you'll have to find them to rank up. At the time Uplay was having massive issues because of the amount of people logging in and the server not being able to handle it, whenever I could get my hands on the multiplay it was fun and enjoyable, though now none of that problem exist because people have moved on and only a handful still plays. One of the multiplayer mode that should had been enjoyable is free roaming but instead there is NOTHING TO DO and that mode is completely BORING because there isn't anything to do besides shennenigans. Also note there is no anti cheat of any kind implemented so the cheating going on now deterred me from the multiplayer and so I moved on.

The game itself uses Uplay which might suck but the game belongs to them so what can you do except voice out your opinion about this.
Optimization really is not that great for this game, alot of the materials that looks great for it is hidden, which a modder found out about and unleashed.


Be warned about system specs though. Hopefully people will be able to enjoy this title but it seems most of the complaints are specs, optimization problems etc because the massive issue is certain people can run it fine, many cannot so hopefully patch fix this. I can run it fine so my review is on the game itself.

This is my spec and it works atm.
 +CPU: Intel Core i7-3960X Extreme Edition +Memory: 64 gig ddr3 2133 Gskill +Video Card: 1x =EVGA 680 GTX SIGNATURE EDITION SUPERCLOCKED


+  voice acting and dialogue really well done voice acting on aiden and nice job on the other characters.
+ The Story is decent.
+ Graphic options that tries to push pc to limit (Note: But fails due to optimization problems atm) Does/will look good if it works and when it works. too bad it didn't look like E3.
+ Hacking is a really fun concept but could use alot more work in the future otherwise sometimes repetitive in terms of missions etc camera switching jumping.
+  music and soundtracks fit the game perfectly
+ Tons of weapons and perk unlocks
+ Openworld roaming of up to 8 players, 1 vs 1 hacking, tailgating, racing, and game invasions. adding replayability. + leaderboard rankings. Though uplay was down on the first day
+ 20 hours if you take your time to find EVERYTHING, 10-12 hours if you rush the single mission
+ Very Good Amount of Collectables to unlock from side missions to minigames you can play + multiplayer to unlock perks, weapons, and vehicles. 

-While multiplayer is fun, the Free roam mode needs alot of work, it is SUPER BORING and offers nothing to do at all besides driving around and shennenigans.
-Not the next gen game as they promised. The graphics were hidden so it caused an uproar until it was unlocked.
-Physics are not next gen at all. Things felt very solid alot of time.
- Uplay service is MEH, having problems finding the multiplayer game when you want to, takes 2-3 mins to find a game. In fact its not working right now so I am bummed out, WAS working fine.
- The specs will affect some people hard, in fact many people, but the game does run fine for some and really horrid for others.
- Game will require you to purchase Deluxe edition + Season pass to get the full content + hours more of contents. Otherwise you're missing out
- Driving Could use alot more work, only great when you update perks a bit but not much, not only that car feels like heavy bricks in terms of handling, when you bump into things it goes flying but the car takes no damage unless you take really really hard hits. Damage also isn't as great but looks fine.
-You'll have to get deluxe and then seasonpass and then more to get more content of course...
- Optimization sucks and sucks hard, IT SUCKS THE HELL OUTTA YOUR PC, IT NEEDS WORK HOPEFULLY WITH PATCHES!  Some people are able to play this game flawlessly, Others cannot. So I can only imagine the problems and hell they are going through.
- doesn't have enough content.
- No anti cheat, cheaters plague the game multiplayer now and so I moved on.

Thats pretty much it, enough said it is a great game, worth the purchase if you can RUN IT and probabaly a good play thus far until something better comes along. Waiting on GTA V
