review:
taken from experts - http://www.gamersnexus.net/games/1487-critical-review-watch-dogs

Starting Hard: Some of the Worst Optimization We've Ever Seen 

Watch Dogs is a good-looking game. It's not this generation's Crysis—not even close—but the graphics technology is impressive and promising. Ubisoft worked within an internal engine, called "Disrupt," and plugged-in Havok for software-accelerated physics. I benchmarked Watch Dogs at launch, whereupon it was discovered that a 780 Ti + 4770K—a setup that'd put you close to $1500-$2000—barely made 50FPS with max settings. The game doesn't look good enough to justify such poor performance, so something was clearly going on under the hood. Further investigation has revealed a myriad of issues that sabotage the PC as a stable platform. For starters, we determined that anti-aliasing of any sort in Watch Dogs produces severe stuttering and even full freezing on some devices (270X, 7870) and significant, disproportionate frame drops on others (780 Ti). The word "disproportionate" is key here, as I've never seen performance halved by going from TSMAA to MSAA 4x in any game before -- ever -- on a 780 Ti. Performance should be impacted, yes, but these are new levels of framerate disparity.

With 5.04 TFLOPS of raw COMPUTE power on 2880 cores, a 3GB framebuffer, and 336GB/s memory bandwidth (384-bit interface / 8 * 1750 clock * 2 for DDR * 2 for GDDR5), dropping to TSMAA shouldn't increase performance from the 50s to the 80-90 range. This is doubly so when considering that a change from Ultra + MSAA 4x to Medium + MSAA 4x saw almost zero performance impact (~10FPS), but dropping from MSAA 4x to TSMAA produced about 30FPS improvement. Something is wrong.

So I thought it'd potentially be a CPU throttle, as I was using a 3570K when performing this test. Switching to the 4770K, which is a generation newer and $100 more expensive, the bench produced one half of one FPS increase. That's within margin of error, so for all intents and purposes, there was 0 difference. It was not a CPU limitation, then.

That's when I started to heavily consider the possibility of absolutely no software-side optimization on part of Ubisoft. This stance was reinforced when testing the performance of an HDD vs. an SSD in gameplay once static assets had been loaded (read: not hitting storage for data much at this point). By switching to an HDD, it became evident that Ubisoft is abusing (or misusing) the pagefile before saturating system memory to any reasonable extent. In fact, Watch Dogs barely utilizes 1.9GB of RAM on max settings. That's even less than Titanfall, a game that's arguably far less graphically-intensive.

And this isn't even getting to the good stuff -- like rampant CTDs, inexcusable BSODs, audio loops, NAT errors, Uplay's inability to stop drooling on itself, random input functionality breaking (enter key), inability to minimize, the "alt" key getting stuck, and more. Years of English classes taught me that "and more" was an excuse not to actually list more; I also worked as a test engineer in a previous life, so doing Ubisoft a favor, I'm going to combine these two experiences and get this out there:  

All this GPU benchmarking, crash fixing, and performance optimizing later, I think it's about time we officially comment on Watch Dogs as more than a benchmarking tool. It is, after all, a vexingly-hyped game leaving a $68 million footprint in Ubisoft's budget. Putting things in perspective, Battlefield 4's budget hit nearly $100 million (and look how that turned out), Destiny's budget is $140 million, but even that is still pennies to GTA V's $265 million budget.

All the millions in the world, though, and I'm not sure Watch Dogs would ever be classifiable as "good" or "playable" for PC gamers.

Unintuitive Input Dooms a Game to User Abandonment


If a game doesn't have intuitive input and mechanics, it's doomed to collecting (now-digital) dust. This dates back to arcade games. In a discussion with Mark Cerny some years ago—a 30-year industry veteran—it was made clear that arcade games were explicitly designed with a single item in mind: Keep the player playing. They're pumping money in for each play -- so how do you get them to play without inducing rage, but simultaneously bolstering arcade profits? Cerny answered this question with great depth, but short of designing play to last 2-3 minutes for the quarter, he made it explicitly clear that the controls must feel intuitive and make sense. This dates back to Cerny's 1983 "Major Havoc." The veteran designer told us that without intuitive input and mechanics, developers risk creating a situation where the player feels somehow cheated, unable to pinpoint why they'd failed at a certain task. If the on-screen result doesn't match what the player's brain tells them is going to happen, there's a disconnect; that disconnect ultimately causes frustration and abandonment.

And so we have Watch Dogs, one of a great many console-to-PC ported titles that has brought along its console input. Watch Dogs fundamentally alters mouse functionality beyond any recognition, and it does so on more than one level.

Most immediately noteworthy is the uncontrollably high sensitivity on the main menu. Easy enough -- just turn the DPI down. Then we get dropped into the game, where suddenly the movement is immeasurably slow. Fine, then -- turn DPI back up. Easily done with most modern mice. Then we hack into a camera, or open the menu, or smartphone, or hack into infrastructure, and input speed has once again been altered. The fact that I've got to use all three DPI profiles on my mouse—menu, camera, shooting—is a red flag for usability.
And that's before even getting into the matter of 'acceleration' and mouse smoothing.

Mouse smoothing is an artifact of the beforetimes, when mice had balls and movement was oft choppy and inconsistent or overly sharp. Enable mouse smoothing with an ultra-high precision mouse, like the G502 we looked at, and it will alter input in a way that feels sluggish and as if the mouse is being dragged through a syrup-coated surface. The effect is "smoother" corners and circles when moving the mouse in such patterns, but that effect is entirely undesirable. When I move the mouse, it's done with purpose. Perhaps not always the correct purpose, but always something that I -- as a user -- have done as second nature. I know that moving my mouse at a certain speed and a certain distance will produce a specific result. I want that result. That's why I've moved in that manner. Watch Dogs, however, enables smoothing by default, which results in insufferable inconsistencies when moving a mouse made after 2001.


and we havent even gotten to the gameplay yet :( this game is so poorly optimised for pc it reminds me of GTA4 when it first came out, and they could not fix that console port either. the bad coding is the backbone of all the problems. they did not even make an effort to get this game to PORT correctly to PC so that its is playable on anything other than minumum to medium settings. the fact that even on high end GPUS and CPUS this game is unplayable and guess what UBISOFT DONT CARE AND THEY WILL NEVER FIX THE GAME.

review: Watch_Dogs isn't the worst game to come out in 2014, but it certainly is not the best either. Its ubisoft so keep that in mind the game does play best at 30 FPS and they did downgrade the graphics. Outside of that its actually a pretty good game. Aiden Pearce is about as entertaining as watching paint dry but the world he is in and the people he interacts with makes this game fun. I recommend this if you catch it on a $10 sale.

review: О боже эта игра законченная и имеет столько нерелизма что я могу столб сломать на 6 кусков, или например врезаться в авто и ничего с ним не произойдет и всего лишь пару царапин останется. Вообщем сюжет то есть и он довольно интересный и захватывающий, но полное отсутствие физики и однообразный и скучный мультиплеер заставил меня пожалеть о потраченных деньгах :(

review: I beileve that people are being too harsh with Watch_Dogs I thought it was a very solid game. Although I admit it had dissapointing graphics, the voice acting was great, the campaign was long and will keep you up for hours, and the multiplayer missions were superb. You can consistantly find me online an running with the file online decrpytion, or hidden in a bush hacking another player. I reccomend this game to any lover of open world genre and anyone who likes to feel like a ruler of a city.

review:
[h1][b]Wertung: 6 von 10 Punkten[/b][/h1]

[code]Watch Dogs könnte so viel besser sein als es sich selber darstellt. Die Technik krankt an allen Ecken und Kanten und trotzdem hat es auch seine schöne Seiten. Das Hacking ist launig und die Spielwelt unterhält mit ihren Umgebungen. Dennoch sollte dieses Spiel nur jemand spielen der um Open World Spiele nicht herum kommt.[/code]

[h1]Story/Atmosphäre/Umfang[/h1] ([b]9 von 10 Punkten[/b])
2 Seelen wohnen ach in meiner Brust. Die eine möchte Watch Dogs für seine Ideen loben, doch die andere möchte die Entwickler für die technische Katastrophe erwürgen. Doch langsam, worum geht es überhaupt? Der Spieler übernimmt die Steuerung über den Hacker Aiden Pearce, der zu Beginn des Spiels vieles verloren hat und während des Spiels in eine waschechte Verschwörung stolpert. 

Das ganze spielt sich in der Third Person Ansicht wie z. B. GTA oder Saints Row, in einer modernen Großstadt, die an das Chicago der Echtzeit erinnern soll. Dafür stehen Aiden diverse Fahrzeuge (Boote, Autos, Motorräder und sogar ein Helikopter) zur Verfügung. 

Wie bei GTA gibt es diverse Möglichkeiten die Spielzeit zu verbringen: Laufe von A nach B und führe Mission X für Person Y aus, erkunde die Stadt nach Sammelobjekten oder vergnüge dich mit Minispielen (z. B. Wetttrinken, was aber von vielen als zu schwer empfunden wird - bzw. wurde da es inzwischen leichter gemacht worden ist).
Unterstützend zu dem üblichen Open World Spielprinzip kann Aiden auf mehrere Hacking Spielerein zurückgreifen um sich Gegner vom Leib zu halten. Er kann z. B. Ampeln manipulieren, Poller hochschnellen lassen, Türen und Toren öffnen und vieles weitere mehr.

Typisch für ein Open World Spiel ist der Spielumfang weit über 50 Stunden angesiedelt, wenn alles gemacht werden will.
Dazu gesellt sich noch ein spaßiger Mulitplayer Modus, in dem eine Art "Capture The Flag", Straßenrennen oder Deathmatch (im Team) gespielt werden kann. Das macht solange Spaß bis diverse unsterbliche Cheater auftauchen.

[h1]Technik[/h1] ([b]3 von 10 Punkten[/b])
Kommen wir zum Kernproblem des Ganzen: die technische Umsetzung. Diese ist eine mittelschwere Katastrophe, bzw. war sie, da sie inzwischen mehr oder weniger durch Patche verbessert worden sind. Für viele (vor allem mit Highend-Grafikkarten) ist das Spiel aber selbst nach 4-5 Monaten noch immer eine Ruckelorgie, ein Trauerspiel für einen so großen Entwickler. Ansonsten hat das Spiel schöne Momente, in denen Regen auf den Asphalt tröpfelt aber auch hässliche Seiten wie eine generell nicht "Next-Gen" aussehende Grafik. Insgesamt kommt die schlechte Wertung aber durch die absolut schlechte Produktpflege zustande. Zu Anfang gab es auch noch diverse Abstürze, welche aber inzwischen größtenteils behoben worden sind.

[h1]Bedienung/Schwierigkeitsgrad[/h1] ([b]7 von 10 Punkten[/b])
Ob nun per Maus und Tastatur oder mit dem Gamepad gespielt wird macht wenig Unterschied. Beide Varianten funktionieren gut. Allerdings sollte im Multiplayer mit Maus und Tastatur gespielt werden, da die Gegner sonst deutliche Vorteile beim Zielen haben. Beide Varianten haben außerdem das Problem der unpräzisen Steuerung, diese fällt sehr schwammig aus. Während dem Fahren von Fahrzeugen merkt man deutliche Unterschiede zwischen den Fahrzeugen und keines davon fährt sich besonders leicht. Das wirkt realistischer und macht nach etwas Eingewöhnung durchaus Spaß.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad geht in Ordnung, da er auch einstellbar ist , z. B. Normal oder Realistisch. Vor allem bei realistisch ist es eine Herausforderung für Veteranen, allerdings keine übergroße.

review:
First off, I pretty much bought Watch_Dogs a few days after it came out. I've been a fan of Assassins Creed and GTA for a long time, and was really looking forward to this game.

I downloaded it and fired it up and played for quite a while. All told, I've got a ton of hours into this game. I think I've had it crash on me exactly once.

My first play through was on a laptop with a GTX 675M video card. Pretty low-end card actually. I got the game to run by turning down most settings, but still managed to enjoy the graphics.

I had a lot of fun with the game and can recommend it. It's not nearly as bad as some people have made it out to be.

This is the first in the series and I can only imagine where they will take it. Already the expansion with T-Bone is showing a lot of improvement over this game, with some exciting and welcome new mechanics.

Recommended!

review:
Нереально скучный сюжет, ужасная физика машин, графика не соответствует системным требованиям (текстуры года 2006), очень однообразные доп. задания. С трудом прошел до конца основной сюжет, где-то на середине уже хотелось проблеваться, удалить эту никчемную игру и никогда о ней не вспоминать. Только мультиплеер был на уровне, хотя для такой распиаренной игры могли бы и получше сделать. Покупать только на распродаже с ОГРОМНОЙ скидкой. Хотя я забыл, что это игра от юбисофт. В ближайшие 2 года не ждите скидки больше 33%.
3/10.
Оптимизация? Что такое оптимизация? (с) Ubisoft

review:
Gelungene Grafik und vom Gameplay her auch sehr schön. Was mich allerdings stört ist , dass man es u schnell durch hat.
Die vielen kleinen Nebenmissionen sind zwar ganz nett aber zum Teil echt härter wie manche Story Mission. 

Der Multiplayer ist auch nicht so schlecht aber .... auf dauer doch etwas trocken.
Die Zusatzmissionen sind Willkommen aber leider auch zu schnell durchgespielt. 

Alles in allem würde ich sagen " Kaufempfehlung " aber leider wird es zu schnell langweilig.
Es müssten mehr Missionen nach kommen bzw mehr Story geben.

Es ist aber auch kein " rausgeworfenes Geld " wie mancher jetzt vielleicht sagen würde. Man kann sich 
in der Atmosphäre die das Spiel bringt echt verlieren.

Alles in allem würde ich sagen " Kaufempfehlung " aber leider wird es zu schnell langweilig.
Es müssten mehr Missionen nach kommen bzw mehr Story geben.

Es ist aber auch kein " rausgeworfenes Geld " wie mancher jetzt vielleicht sagen würde. Man kann sich 
in der Atmosphäre die das Spiel bringt echt verlieren.

review:
Поиграв 12 часов в игру я просто не понимаю почему её так сильно ругают. Из-за того что она не оправдала ожиданий кучки безмозглых школьников? Вот до сих пор в людях сохранилась доисторическая стадность, ну да ладно перейду к обзору.

Плюсы игры:

+Сюжет игры действительно хорош, Юбисофт умею показывать то, как живет герой, что он чувствует, да и что вообще творится по ходу действия игры.
+Пусть и не самый большой, но хорошо проработанный мир, есть где погулять, повзламывать.
+Бесшовный мультиплеер, не нужно запускать отдельный клиент, просто зашел в телефон, выбрал соответствующий пункт в меню, выбрал контракт и за дело.
+Система перков дает стимул к прокачке навыков взлома, вождения, стрельбы и т.д (в некоторых случаях без определенных перков не обойтись)
+Красивая графика (лично для меня, игру за это ругают только школьники у которых до сих пор видюхи с 512 мб памяти)
+Неплохой арсенал
+Достаточное кол-во транспорта, поделенное по классам.

К сожалению, не обошлось и без минусов:
- Баги с кнопками WASD
- Довольно своеобразная физика 
- Баги с самим изображением (иногда всяккие мигающие квадратики мозолят глаза), для сведения видюха у меня MSI Radeon 280X Gaming 3GB (есть еще на 6 GB, кто в танке)
- Нет модификации оружия (на всю игру без DLC 1 ствол с глушителем), но не слишком и критично.

В целом игра мне нравится, довльно таки годных игр мало сейчас (ждём осенние релизы ^_^). Сравнивать Watch_Dogs c GTA 5 нельзя, а те кто это делают либо школьники, либо люди с 3 степенью синдрома Дауна. Это 2 разные игры, 2 разных разработчика, 2 разные тематики. 

Короче, свое мнение я высказал, покупать игру или нет - дело ваше, я считаю что деньги я потратил не зря.

review: A bit too many people will disagree with me when I say that Watch_Dogs was actually a really good game. No, it did not live up to it’s expectations but when you look past what you WANTED and see what you actually got, it is a really really fun game! Ya, a few bugs and very blah side missions and activities but the game was A LOT of fun! It took me 48 hours to get through almost everything before I got bored so I really think Watch Dogs is worth your money! I highly recommend this game!

review:
Стартуем! 
Watch_Dogs мне понравилась всем советую её купить, наслаждение от игры было невероятно большим, возможно из за предзаказа, но не в этом пёс. 
Сюжет игры разворачивается вокруг красивого и яркого города Чикаго. Главный герой- хакер по имени Эйден Пирс. У персонажа погибла дочь (ели не ошибаюсь) и наш хакер начинает мстить. 
вскоре у него похищают сестру а его племянник убегает, и в один ужасный день видит, как его дядя убивает целую армию людей и тут наш герой решает измениться...
Конец игры очень понравился(весь чикаго обесточен ня ня ня)

review:
Não recomendo de nem uma forma, se você tiver um PC mediano ou um pouco mais potente NÃO COMPRE. Jogo muito MAL otimizado. Eu rodo BF4 no ULTRA mas nao rodo esse jogo nem no medio.

Historia clichê, personagens ruins, nem dá pra fazer muita coisa com os "hacks" pelo celular, a cidade não tem muitas coisas pra fazer, BUGS, BUGS EVERWHERE. Fisica pessima, jagabilidade com os carros ruins!

Resumo:
Não compre! Nem com desconto.
